<p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=rochester" rel="city">ROCHESTER</a>, Oct. 30, <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?year=1867">1867</a>. 
</p><p>
MY DEAR <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?tla=ezk" rel="met friend">MRS. KECKLEY</a> : It is just possible that I may not take <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=new york" rel="city">New York</a> in my route home 
ward. In that case please write me directly at <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=rochester" rel="city">ROCHESTER</a>, and let me know fully how the subscription business is proceeding. The meeting 
here last night was a grand success. I speak again this evening, and perhaps at Reading tomorrow evening. My kind regards to all who 
think of me at 21, including Mrs. Lawrence. 
</p><p>
Yery truly yours, 
</p><p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?tla=frd" rel="me">FREDERICK DOUGLASS</a>.
</p>
